title: News. Views. Hughes - October 28, 2019 (17:00 ET)
text:
TikTok refutes claims of Chinese gov't 'influence'

Popular social media app TikTok is denying claims that it allows Beijing to censor content and collect users' data. Meanwhile, UK PM Boris Johnson intends to give Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei access to parts of its 5G network. RT America’s Rachel Blevins reports for News.Views.Hughes.

MSM reacts to most wanted terrorist's death

Steve Malzberg (in for Scottie Nell Hughes) discusses the mainstream media reactions to President Trump’s lurid description of the death of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. Then civil rights attorney Robert Patillo and Ned Ryun, CEO of American Majority, join to discuss the impeachment inquiry into President Trump.
description:
TikTok refutes claims of Chinese gov't 'influence' 
Popular social media app TikTok is denying claims that it allows Beijing to censor content and collect users' data
